channel.title: Comments on: How to Install SRA Toolkit in Ubuntu 20.04

item.title: By: Santi
item.dc:creator: Santi
item.description: Hi, I really like the way you explain the steps, I am really grateful for it. Nonetheless, when I used this "command tar -vxzf sratoolkit.tar.gz" I got an error that says: "tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now". How can I solve this? Thanks again for your help.
item.content:encoded:
Hi, I really like the way you explain the steps, I am really grateful for it.
Nonetheless, when I used this “command tar -vxzf sratoolkit.tar.gz” I got an error that says: “tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now”. How can I solve this?
Thanks again for your help.

item.title: By: AOMIE
item.dc:creator: AOMIE
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://netmiko.com/install-sra-toolkit-in-ubuntu/#comment-672">Firdaus</a>.
Try to install sra again, you might have missed a step or miss typed something.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Firdaus.

Try to install sra again, you might have missed a step or miss typed something.

item.title: By: Victor
item.dc:creator: Victor
item.description: Thank you, you helped me a lot.
item.content:encoded: Thank you, you helped me a lot.

item.title: By: Firdaus
item.dc:creator: Firdaus
item.description: I followed all steps as you mentioned but I wanted to check that sratoolkit is functional or not ,I entered sra number given by you and it gave error that it couldn't find.why is this so?
item.content:encoded: I followed all steps as you mentioned but I wanted to check that sratoolkit is functional or not ,I entered sra number given by you and it gave error that it couldn’t find.why is this so?
